intro: Bhidea borii, commonly known as the mountain saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, white or pinkish flowers in the summer. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Bhidea borii is often found in mountain meadows and is a member of the Polygonaceae family. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in alpine ecosystems.
